Weekend Busing On Pascack Valley Line, Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1

Buses will substitute for trains on the Pascack Valley Line between Spring Valley and Secaucus Junction for the entire weekend of Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1. This service change is taking place to accommodate scheduled grade crossing repairs and to conduct signal and track maintenance work. During this busing period, Pascack Valley Line customers from Spring Valley, Nanuet and Pearl Valley may opt to use their monthly/weekly commutation tickets on the Hudson Line for travel between Tarrytown Station and Grand Central Terminal. Regular service will resume on Mon., Nov. 2. For complete details, visit NJ TRANSIT at http://bit.ly/1WkyWpw

Weekend Busing On Pascack Valley Line, Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1

Buses will substitute for trains on the Pascack Valley Line between Spring Valley and Secaucus Junction for the entire weekend of Sat., Oct. 31-Sun., Nov. 1. This service change is taking place to accommodate scheduled grade crossing repairs and to conduct signal and track maintenance work. During this busing period, Pascack Valley Line customers from Spring Valley, Nanuet and Pearl Valley may opt to use their monthly/weekly commutation tickets on the Hudson Line for travel between Tarrytown Station and Grand Central Terminal. Regular service will resume on Mon., Nov. 2. For complete details, visit NJ TRANSIT at http://bit.ly/1WkyWpw

Penn Station Systems Testing at 11:40 AM Today

At 11:40AM this morning, the LIRR will perform systems testing in Penn Station for about 15 mins. At that time, there will be no information displayed on the station's departure boards/monitors, ticket sales will not be available from ticket machines. PA announcements, lighting & escalators/elevators will also not be available. LIRR personnel will be available throughout the station for assistance. Trains will be unaffected by the testing. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Reduced Overnight Hudson Line Weekend Service

Metro-North is reducing overnight Hudson Line train service between 9 p.m. and 10 a.m. on three Friday nights/Saturday mornings this autumn as workers building the New NY Bridge install 700-ton girder assemblies over the tracks at Tarrytown. Reduced Overnight Hudson Line Weekend Service

Metro-North is reducing overnight Hudson Line train service between 9 p.m. and 10 a.m. on three Friday nights/Saturday mornings this autumn as workers building the New NY Bridge install 700-ton girder assemblies over the tracks at Tarrytown. Exact dates for the work will be announced by the New NY Bridge team, but the first is planned for Oct. 23-24. See full details at http://bit.ly/1VWkfbT
Pascack Valley Line: Buses Replace Trains between Spring Valley and Park Ridge Sat., Oct. 24 for Eme

Buses will replace trains on the Pascack Valley Line between Spring Valley and Park Ridge stations on Saturday, October 24 from 8 AM to 7 PM due to emergency road crossing repairs. Regular rail service will resume on Sunday, October 25. See full details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=13262
Port Jervis Line Weekday Off-Peak Busing Begins October 26

Weekday off-peak busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Middletown for select trains beginning Mon., October 26. Buses will follow train schedules. The following trains will be bused: From Port Jervis: 9: 26 AM 11:30 AM 1:39 PM From Middletown: 10:16 AM 11:44 AM This service change will allow us to perform track work between Port Jervis and Otisville stations. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Special Timetables for ALL Branches THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

THIS WEEKEND, Sat. & Sun. Oct. 24-25, ALL LIRR branches will have special timetables due to the Ellison Ave. Bridge Installation work. While the greatest impact on train service will be on the Port Jefferson and Ronkonkoma branches, ALL LIRR branches will be affected with revised departure and arrival times for weekend trains. Please see the special Oct. 24-25 weekend timetable for your branch. For additional info on this weekend's work and its impact on service see http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd.
Ronkonkoma Br. Service Affected THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24 & 25, Ronkonkoma Branch trains will be diverted to the Babylon & Central branches for service to/from stations Farmingdale thru Ronkonkoma from 7 AM-midnight due to Ellison Ave. Bridge work. See http://bit.ly/1LSatbv. Other times, buses replace trains between Mineola & Hicksville. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable at http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd; and additional info at http://bit.ly/1OIzfts
Pt. Jefferson Br. Service Affected THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24 & 25, buses replace trains on Pt. Jefferson Br. between Mineola & Hicksville to accommodate the installation of the new Ellison Ave. Bridge in Westbury. See http://bit.ly/1MtPSop. Half-hourly service is reduced to hourly between Penn Sta. & Huntington; service between Huntington & Pt. Jeff is reduced to 2-hourly intervals. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable at http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd; and additional info at http://bit.ly/1OIzfts.

Reduced Overnight Hudson Line Weekend Service

Metro-North is reducing overnight Hudson Line train service between 9 p.m. and 10 a.m. on three Friday nights/Saturday mornings this autumn as workers building the New NY Bridge install 700-ton girder assemblies over the tracks at Tarrytown. Exact dates for the work will be announced by the New NY Bridge team, but the first is planned for Oct. 23-24. See full details at http://bit.ly/1VWkfbT
Port Jervis Line Weekday Off-Peak Busing Begins October 26

Weekday off-peak busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Middletown for select trains beginning Mon., October 26. Buses will follow train schedules. The following trains will be bused: From Port Jervis: 9: 26 AM 11:30 AM 1:39 PM From Middletown: 10:16 AM 11:44 AM This service change will allow us to perform track work between Port Jervis and Otisville stations. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Pascack Valley Line: Buses Replace Trains between Spring Valley and Park Ridge Sat., Oct. 24 for Eme

Buses will replace trains on the Pascack Valley Line between Spring Valley and Park Ridge stations on Saturday, October 24 from 8 AM to 7 PM due to emergency road crossing repairs. Reduced Overnight Hudson Line Weekend Service

Metro-North is reducing overnight Hudson Line train service between 9 p.m. and 10 a.m. on three Friday nights/Saturday mornings this autumn as workers building the New NY Bridge install 700-ton girder assemblies over the tracks at Tarrytown. Exact dates for the work will be announced by the New NY Bridge team, but the first is planned for Oct. 23-24. See full details at http://bit.ly/1VWkfbT
Port Jervis Line Weekday Off-Peak Busing Begins October 26

Weekday off-peak busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Middletown for select trains beginning Mon., October 26. Buses will follow train schedules. The following trains will be bused: From Port Jervis: 9: 26 AM 11:30 AM 1:39 PM From Middletown: 10:16 AM 11:44 AM This service change will allow us to perform track work between Port Jervis and Otisville stations. We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Special Timetables for ALL Branches THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

THIS WEEKEND, Sat. & Sun. Oct. 24-25, ALL LIRR branches will have special timetables due to the Ellison Ave. Bridge Installation work. While the greatest impact on train service will be on the Port Jefferson and Ronkonkoma branches, ALL LIRR branches will be affected with revised departure and arrival times for weekend trains. Please see the special Oct. 24-25 weekend timetable for your branch. For additional info on this weekend's work and its impact on service see http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd.
Ronkonkoma Br. Service Affected THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24 & 25, Ronkonkoma Branch trains will be diverted to the Babylon & Central branches for service to/from stations Farmingdale thru Ronkonkoma from 7 AM-midnight due to Ellison Ave. Bridge work. See http://bit.ly/1LSatbv. Other times, buses replace trains between Mineola & Hicksville. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable at http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd; and additional info at http://bit.ly/1OIzfts
Pt. Jefferson Br. Service Affected THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

THIS WEEKEND, Oct. 24 & 25, buses replace trains on Pt. Jefferson Br. between Mineola & Hicksville to accommodate the installation of the new Ellison Ave. Bridge in Westbury. See http://bit.ly/1MtPSop. Half-hourly service is reduced to hourly between Penn Sta. & Huntington; service between Huntington & Pt. Jeff is reduced to 2-hourly intervals. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable at http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd; and additional info at http://bit.ly/1OIzfts.

New Haven Line AM Peak Opposite-Side Boarding thru Oct 26

New Haven Line Customers please be advised that there will be opposite side boarding at West Haven, Stratford and Milford during the AM Peak Rush Hours through Monday, October 26th; opposite side boarding may also occur at Bridgeport. Ronkonkoma Br. Service Affected NEXT WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

NEXT WEEKEND, Oct. 24 & 25, Ronkonkoma Branch trains will be diverted to the Babylon & Central branches for service to/from stations Farmingdale thru Ronkonkoma from 7 AM-midnight due to Ellison Ave. Bridge work. See http://bit.ly/1LSatbv. Other times, buses replace trains between Mineola & Hicksville. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable at http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd; and additional info at http://bit.ly/1OIzfts
Pt. Jefferson Br. Service Affected NEXT WEEKEND, Oct. 24-25

NEXT WEEKEND, Oct. 24 & 25, buses replace trains on Pt. Jefferson Br. between Mineola & Hicksville to accommodate the installation of the new Ellison Ave. Bridge in Westbury. Half-hourly service is reduced to hourly between Penn Sta. & Huntington; service between Huntington & Pt. Jeff is reduced to 2-hourly intervals. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable at http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd; and additional info at http://bit.ly/1OIzfts

Reduced Overnight Hudson Line Weekend Service

Metro-North is reducing overnight Hudson Line train service between 9 p.m. and 10 a.m. on three Friday nights/Saturday mornings this autumn as workers building the New NY Bridge install 700-ton girder assemblies over the tracks at Tarrytown. Exact dates for the work will be announced by the New NY Bridge team, but the first is planned for Oct. 23-24. See full details at http://bit.ly/1VWkfbT

LIRR Service to National League Championship Series Oct. 17-18

This weekend, Oct. 17 & 18, The LIRR will provide convenient service every 30 minutes right to and from Citi Field before, during, and after the Mets games via the Port Washington Branch. The LIRR's Mets-Willets Point station is just 19 minutes from Penn Station and 27 minutes from Port Washington. Fans traveling from Long Island on other branches can reach Citi Field by changing to Port Washington Branch trains at Woodside, just a five-minute ride. LIRR Offers Extra Trains & Package Ticket to Annual Oyster Festival in Oyster Bay

This weekend, Oct. 17 & 18, the LIRR is providing extra trains to/from Oyster Bay for the 32nd Annual Oyster Festival. Specially-priced One-Day Getaway package tickets and off-peak fares are available at Ticket Windows and Full Service Ticket Machines. Take your LIRR ticket with you when exiting the train; it will be collected at Oyster Bay Station. See http://bit.ly/1MtPSop. Half-hourly service is reduced to hourly between Penn Sta. & Huntington; service between Huntington & Pt. Jeff is reduced to 2-hourly intervals. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable at http://bit.ly/1GJ11Qd; and additional info at http://bit.ly/1OIzfts.
Reduced Overnight Hudson Line Weekend Service

Metro-North is reducing overnight Hudson Line train service between 9 p.m. and 10 a.m. on three Friday nights/Saturday mornings this autumn as workers building the New NY Bridge install 700-ton girder assemblies over the tracks at Tarrytown. LIRR Service to National League Championship Series Oct. 17-18

This weekend, Oct. 17 & 18, The LIRR will provide convenient service every 30 minutes right to and from Citi Field before, during, and after the games via the Port Washington Branch. The LIRR's Mets-Willets Point station is just 19 minutes from Penn Station and 27 minutes from Port Washington. Fans traveling from Long Island on other branches can reach Citi Field by changing to Port Washington Branch trains at Woodside, just a five-minute ride. Bridgeplates Remain in Service at Devon Transfer Thru October 26

Bridgeplates will remain in service at Devon Transfer thru October 26. This is necessary to allow for the continuing installation of bridge timbers on the moveable span at Devon Bridge. Two additional bridgeplates have been installed to accommodate customer boarding and detraining at the Transfer. Customers are urged to wait until the train has stopped at the Transfer and everyone has detrained before attempting to cross the bridgeplate, and to walk slowly and use the handrails. We appreciate your patience during this improvement to our right-of-way.

Bridgeplates Remain in Service at Devon Transfer Thru October 26

Bridgeplates will remain in service at Devon Transfer thru October 26. This is necessary to allow for the continuing installation of bridge timbers on the moveable span at Devon Bridge. Two additional bridgeplates have been installed to accommodate customer boarding and detraining at the Transfer. Customers are urged to wait until the train has stopped at the Transfer and everyone has detrained before attempting to cross the bridgeplate, and to walk slowly and use the handrails. We appreciate your patience during this improvement to our right-of-way.

An Explanation For This Mornings Delays

The delay of up to 20 minutes that you may have experienced during this mornings commute in the vicinity of 125th Street was due to a component failure of the Harlem River Lift Bridge, which resulted in the need to impose speed restrictions of 15 mph to our signal system to ensure operational safety. Our repair crews responded immediately and resolved the issue within 45 minutes. Unfortunately, this failure occurred at the height of the rush hour at a critical juncture where all our trains operate, resulting in significant congestion and delays. We are investigating the cause of this failure and we regret any inconvenience you may have experienced.

An Explanation For This Morning's Delays On Our Harlem & New Haven Lines

To Our Harlem & New Haven Line Customers: The delays of up to 25 minutes that you may have experienced during this mornings commute were caused by the 6:56 AM train from Stamford which became disabled in a critical location near Woodlawn Station on the Harlem Line. The M8 train was unable to take power due to failure of the electrical connection between the cars on the train. This electrical control failure prevented the train from continuing in service. Because the train failed at a juncture where tracks cross overand where our Harlem and New Haven Lines meetthis delayed subsequent trains, causing congestion to quickly build up. We are currently investigating the cause of this failure and will take corrective action. We regret any inconvenience you may have experienced.

New New Haven & Harlem Line Timetables Effective October 4

New Harlem & New Haven Line schedules effective Sunday October 4 continue to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. See more details at http://bit.ly/1EVLb9i New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying station ticket offices, on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk, or on our Train Time App (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ).
New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 to Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. Weekday schedules will feature minimal service changes. See full details at http://bit.ly/1EVLb9i New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying station ticket offices, on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or on our Train Time App (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ).
New Haven Line AM Peak Opposite-Side Boarding Oct 5 -16

New Haven Line Customers please be advised that effective Monday, October 5th there will be opposite side boarding at West Haven, Stratford and Milford during the AM Peak Rush Hours through Friday, October 16th. This change to service is a result of necessary track work in that vicinity. Please listen for announcements as there could be changes to service during these hours as needed. We thank you for your patience as we continue to make improvements along our right-of-way.

New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 to Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. Weekday schedules will feature minimal service changes. See full details at http://bit.ly/1EVLb9i New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying station ticket offices, on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or on our Train Time App (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ).

New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Hudson Line customers should use the new timetable beginning on Saturday, October 3. The prior timetable with the end date of October 3 will no longer be in effect. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 - Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. On weekends, customers traveling from points north of Croton-Harmon will need to make an across-platform change of trains at Croton-Harmon. Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Hudson Line customers should use the new timetable beginning on Saturday, October 3. The prior timetable with the end date of October 3 will no longer be in effect. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 - Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. On weekends, customers traveling from points north of Croton-Harmon will need to make an across-platform change of trains at Croton-Harmon. New New Haven & Harlem Line Timetables Effective October 4

New Harlem & New Haven Line schedules effective Sunday October 4 continue to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. See more details at http://bit.ly/1EVLb9i New timetables will be available in Grand Central, at outlying station ticket offices, on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk, or on our Train Time App (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ).

New Hudson Line Timetable Effective October 3

Our New Hudson Line schedule effective Saturday, October 3 continues to provide you with a safe and reliable service while accommodating our program of aggressive improvements along our right-of-way. Hudson Line customers should use the new timetable beginning on Saturday, October 3. The prior timetable with the end date of October 3 will no longer be in effect. Key changes to look for: We are doing major switch replacement at a location in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium which will require a Special Weekend Construction Schedule to be in effect from Saturday, October 3 - Sunday, November 15. Most of this work will be done during off-peak hours and on weekends in order to minimize any impact on your commute. On weekends, customers traveling from points north of Croton-Harmon will need to make an across-platform change of trains at Croton-Harmon.
